intro: Seguieria affinis, commonly known as the Florida morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, pale blue to white flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Seguieria affinis is an important species for ecological studies due to its unique adaptations to wetland environments.
